description.narrative: To extend Forest Service efforts to improve forest policies and practices internationally, address climate change, conserve and protect critical global forest environments and resources, and improve the lives of forest-dependent peoples by awarding grants to and entering into cooperative agreements with nonprofit organizations, multilateral organizations, and other individuals, organizations, institutions, and governments engaged in forest conservation and management.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Forest and Rangeland Research, Forest Service
Forest and Rangeland Research, Forest Service

description.narrative: Activity 1: Poultry Health Training for poultry veterinarians in cooperation with the Indonesian Poultry Veterinarian Association (IPVA). APHIS Jakarta conducted training in West Java and wants to expand the training to other major poultry production areas in East Java, Central Java, and Lampung in southern Sumatra. The target areas along with West Java are the major commercial poultry producers in Indonesia. The target audiences for the trainings are poultry veterinarians from industry, government and small producers. The trainings are registered as continuing education credits under the Indonesian Veterinary Medical Association (IVMA). The requested funding will cover the preparation phase and implementation of the Poultry Health Training. Activity 2: 10/18-12/21/2011 In the initial phase the Jakarta Ag-Scientist visited one district in West Java Province to develop a relationship with a local poultry company and to implement a biosecurity risk assessment with some of the company's contract grower farms. Objectives of the training included, developing best practices on biosecur

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: From May 2-13, 2016, the participants, all trained veterinarians, were trained in epidemiological skills necessary to identify and manage disease outbreaks. In addition, they learned skills in geospatial analysis necessary for establishing parameters to effectively control the outbreak and identify the risks associated with the outbreak. Indian veterinarians receive little or no training in epidemiology therefore it is vital that they have the opportunity to train in the environment.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: APHIS ITRCB in coordination with APHIS/Bangkok and USDA/FAS/Jakarta offered at the request of the Indonesia NPPO, to implement a Cold Treatment training for Indonesia quarantine inspectors in Surabaya, Indonesia.

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.
